greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of partitions of n into k sorts of parts; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
comment: In general, column k > 1 is asymptotic to c * k^n, where c = Product_{j>=1} 1/(1-1/k^j) = 1/QPochhammer[1/k,1/k]. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Mar 19 2015
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..140, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, i, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, `if`(i<1, 0,
mathematica: b[n_, i_, k_] := b[n, i, k] = If[n == 0, 1, If[i<1, 0, b[n, i-1, k] + If[i>n, 0, k*b[n-i, i, k]]]]; A[n_, k_] := b[n, n, k];  Table[Table[A[n, d-n], {n, 0, d}], {d, 0, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 03 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 08 2014
